ranked_diseases.explanation: Axillary and inguinal freckling, along with cafe-au-lait spots, are hallmark features of Neurofibromatosis type 1.
Legius syndrome presents with cafe-au-lait spots and axillary freckling, similar to Neurofibromatosis type 1, but lacks neurofibromas.
Noonan syndrome with multiple lentigines can present with freckling and cafe-au-lait spots, though it is typically associated with other features like cardiac abnormalities.
McCune-Albright syndrome can present with cafe-au-lait spots, but typically also includes polyostotic fibrous dysplasia and endocrine abnormalities.
Carney complex can present with skin pigmentation including cafe-au-lait spots and freckling, but is also associated with myxomas and endocrine overactivity.
